Doctors strike.description: KOLKATA: Junior doctors in Bengal finally called off their week-long strike and promised to resume duty on Tuesday morning, ending a stir that crippled out patient departments (OPDs) and severely hit emergency services at hospitals across the state. At a meeting held at state secretariat Nabanna on Monday evening, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee told a team of 31 junior doctors, " Lakkhi chhele, ebar tomra strike tule nao (Please withdraw your strike like good boys)", which they agreed to. The "cordial" negotiations between the CM and doctors were broadcast live for about 100 minutes by two regional channels. The doctors, who had adopted a strident posture against the administration for the initial police inaction against the kin of a bereaved patient at NRS Hospital last Monday (incident that triggered the stir) relented in the face of genuine-sounding assurances from the CM. The state administration medical fraternity face-off escalated after Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee issued a stern warning of action against the strike during her visit to SSKM Hospital last Thursday. What could have also played on their minds was the rising public opinion against the continuing strike, especially after the CM's appeal for talks last weekend. The striking doctors returned to the NRS campus on Monday and, after another general-body meeting, made a statement: "We hereby announce the withdrawal of the strike by junior doctors." Several issues were discussed at the meeting. They ranged from security measures - collapsible gates for emergency wards, regulated entry for patients' kin and enhanced police presence on medical campuses with nodal officers responsible for law and order - to the CM's suggestion for third-party PR professionals, who could act as grief counsellors and handle communication between "overworked doctors" and "aggrieved patients' kin" and grievance cells for patients. "We are delighted with the cordial manner in which the meeting was held, the CM's caring touch and concrete suggestions and assurances to the issues raised by us," one of the junior doctors said. "They (doctors) have genuine demands. We have listened to them and taken decisions to resolve them. This must be a continuous process. We have to see to it that such untoward incidents are averted and action is taken if something happens," Mamata said. The CM's "gentleness", however, came with the message that she could not be bullied. Urged by the junior doctors to visit the doctor who was injured in the NRS attack, and come to the NRS campus, she said, "Leave certain things to us...Give me your word that you will resume duty." Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mumbai: One held with Rs 2 crore whale v.description: MUMBAI: A 53-year-old man who had come to sell 1kg of whale fish vomit valued around Rs 1.70 crore was arrested on Saturday. ‘Whale vomit’ or ambergris is a wax that originates as a secretion in the intestines of the sperm whale and is used to manufacture perfumes. The accused, Rahul Krishna Duphare, came near Vidyavihar railway station to sell the whale vomit, said an official from Ghatkopar police station. A police team that had got a tip searched him and found 1kg 130 gm of the stone-like material. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Mumbai Abilympics saw participants bag f.description: The first regional Abilympics in Mumbai saw around 450 People with Disabilities (PwDs) from Maharashtra and Gujarat at the two-day grand event held in the city. Eighteen promising PwDs have secured their place in the National Abilympics, which will be held later this year, to further qualify for the International Abilympics in Moscow in 2020. The Mumbai round saw five participants winning gold, seven silver and six bronze medals in various categories like gaming, bakery, floral arrangement and cooking. The event was hosted by the National Abilympics Association of India (NAAI), and also saw job fairs for PwDs and hard-hitting discourses on the self-sustainability of PwDs in the country. Why disability issues need to go mainstream?The event also hosted a panel discussion on ‘Mainstreaming of Disability Issues in Media Discourse’ in the presence of filmmaker Mahesh Bhatt and actor Pooja Bhatt. " I urge corporate houses to provide employment opportunities to disabled people in the country, and fulfill our corporate social responsibilities in the truest manner”, said Mahesh Bhatt, adding that “We should support and take forward people from disabled categories because if we are not able to do that then, we will be doing injustice to ourselves. I feel if a society will not include so-called vulnerable people in its progress, then that society will not be able to reach anywhere.” How Abilympics is helping PwDs realise their dreams…This skill-based competition is organised annually, and provides a platform for the differently-abled to compete among themselves. The events test participants’ mental. Physical and creative abilities as they display their skills across varied categories from computer programming to floral arrangement. Virendra Rana who is orthopedically challenged won a silver medal in the floral arrangement skill test for the second consecutive year. He said, “I am excited to be a part of this event and I encouraged my wife, who is a polio patient to also take part for the first time in the same skill test.” Likewise, Sarvya Haresh who won a gold in the food competition added, “I have been bitten by the entrepreneurial bug and aim to start my own restaurant someday.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. \nSajid Nadiadwala conferred with Cheval.description: Sajid Nadiadwala, on Tuesday, was conferred with the Chevalier dans l’Ordre des Arts et des Lettres (Knight of the Order of Arts and Letters) by Alexandre Ziegler (French Ambassador to India). While his wife Warda Nadiadwala kept him company, his friends and colleagues from the industry cheered him on. Sajid said, “France is a beautiful country which is not completely tapped in our films. Shooting there has been such a delight.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\u2018Indecent\u2019 mannequins in Mumba.description: MUMBAI: Almost six years after former BJP corporator Ritu Tawade from Ghatkopar had proposed a ban on lingerie mannequins in Mumbai as they “display a woman’s body simply for advertising and unnecessarily attract male attention”, civic law committee members on Monday directed Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation to take action against those on municipal roads. Committee chairman Sheetal Mhatre said, “I have sought action within a fortnight as these mannequins are placed outside shops, encroaching on municipal land. It is similar to illegal hawkers who use trees along roadsides to display wares.” BMC stated that following the proposal, as the civic administration had no power to take action under Mumbai Municipal Corporation (MMC) Act (1888), they had sought directions from the state government as an authorized government gazetted officer can take action under Indecent Representation of Woman (Prohibition) Act 1986. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Consider ramps for differently-abled in.description: MUMBAI: Bombay high court on Monday directed the Railways to reply if it can place collapsible ramps at doors of local train coaches meant for differently-abled. “With people swarming stations, how do these people cut through the maze? There is so much of jostling,’’ said a bench of Chief Justice Pradeep Nandrajog and Justice Nitin Jamdar. The court heard a PIL filed in 2007 by India Centre for Human Rights and Law for making Mumbai’s locals disabled-friendly. The HC had earlier directed the Railways to provide amenities like ramps, low-height booking windows and drinking water taps. The NGO’s advocate, Meenaz Kakalia, said a survey by the petitioner showed that the Railways were not conforming to its guidelines for making stations disabled-friendly. The judges lamented that after 12 years of the PIL, the Railways were “just beating about the bush”. The CJ asked, “What is the solution to the problem?” The bench asked if the differently-abled can access platforms and enter coaches with people swarming stations. The Railways’ advocate, Suresh Kumar, said access facilities were provided in long-distance trains. The judges reminded him that the petition was for local trains. Kumar said it was necessary to maintain a certain distance between the platform and the train’s footboard. The judges suggested that trains have lever-operated ramps. When Kumar said it was not possible in Mumbai as trains stop for “15-20 seconds”, the CJ replied, “Increase it. Make it one minute.’’ Kumar said that even a five-second delay would lead to a substantial disruption in suburban services. “In effect, you are saying that persons with disabilities can’t use trains,’’ said the CJ, adding that the Railways has to comply with the Persons with Disabilities Act. The Railways was directed to reply after four weeks, stating what needs to be done. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

High court raps Maharashtra government f.description: MUMBAI: Bombay high court on Monday came down hard on the state government for constituting committees to identify critical wildlife areas in Maharashtra nearly 12 years after the Forest Act, 2006, came into force. “It takes 12 years for the committees to be constituted. They will now say we will take 100 more years to identify critical wildlife areas,” remarked a bench of chief justice Pradeep Nandrajog and justice Nitin Jamdar. The court was hearing a public interest litigation by NGO Vanashakti on protection and conservation of wildlife and wildlife habitat following the failure of authorities to demarcate critical wildlife habitats in forest areas. Advocates Ahmed Abdi and Zaman Ali argued that many critically endangered species had become extinct due to inaction on the part of authorities. The court was told there are 49 wildlife sanctuaries and six national parks in Maharashtra. The judges noted that the 2006 Act states critical wildlife habitats need to be kept inviolated and free from human intervention. They lamented such legislations give reason to evict tribals from forest areas. “The tribal is the best guardian of the forest. Actual culprits are those who make resorts,” said the CJ. “Because we have taken over the right to be custodians of forests, we have become custodians of forests,” said the CJ, adding the court would monitor the PIL in a careful manner. In-charge government pleader, Priyabhushan Kakade, said, in January 2018, the Central government had issued guidelines on demarcation of critical wildlife habitat and the state government had formed 36 committees in August 2018. Abdi said nothing had moved forward after formation of the committees and the work of committees had remained only on paper. The judges then directed the government to inform the court at the next hearing what scientific and objective criteria the committees would employ to identify critical wildlife habitats. Still no Muslim in Maharashtra governmen.description: MUMBAI: The non-inclusion of a Muslim in the latest expansion of cabinet by CM Devendra Fadnavis has come under flak from community leaders, who felt despite PM Modi’s ‘sabka saath, sabka vikas and vishwas’ slogan the promise of an inclusive agenda remains unfulfilled. “Like his earlier slogans, the new slogan where the PM added vishwas (trust) to sabka saath and sabka vikas is empty. He wants sabka saath but there is no inclusive vikas or growth. Leaving out Muslims from the new cabinet is the latest example,” said deputy opposition leader Arif Naseem Khan. BJP had fielded just one Muslim (Pasha Patel) in the 2014 assembly elections in the state but he lost. There are a few more Muslims in the party like BJP city vice-president and chairman of Maulana Azad Minorities Development Corporation chairman Hyder Azam who could have been considered for a minister’s post, many said. Senior cleric Maulana Mahmood Daryabadi of All India Ulema Council said BJP is not serious in winning the community’s trust. “This is perhaps the first time in Maharashtra that no Muslim is a minister. Even the Shiv Sena in the 1990s had made a Muslim (Sabir Shaikh) a minister,” said Daryabadi. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\n'Mirzya' cast bonds over dinner in Mum.description: It was double celebrations for Rohit Khattar, who recently hosted a dinner for the cast of 'Mirzya', which will hit screens on October 7. He not only celebrated the positive response the trailer and the songs of his film have received, but also welcomed his award-winning restaurant, Indian Accent, from New Delhi, which has created a pop-up restaurant for a few days at Magazine Street Kitchen in Mumbai. Enjoying the exquisite sit-down menu were the director of 'Mirzya', Rakeysh Omprakash Mehra, and the lead stars, Harshvardhan Kapoor and Saiyami Kher. While Harsh’s papa Anil Kapoor missed the do because of his prior commitment, the rest of his family, including mom Sunita Kapoor, sister Rhea and cousin Arjun Kapoor, gave him company. Others spotted at the party include Bharathi Mehra, Anuj Chaudhry, Ramesh and Kiran Sippy, Poonam Dhillon with daughter Paloma and actor-son Anmol, Nandita Das, Tisca Chopra and Shobhaa De. Raveena Tandon and her film distrubutor-husband Anil Thadani, who has partnered with Rohit to launch an overseas distribution company, were spotted engaged in a lively conversation. Rohit (Owner of Indian Accent and Chairman of Cinestaan Film Company, which is producing 'Mirzya' along with ROMP Pictures) said, “We celebrated the success of the fim’s music and bid farewell to Rakeysh and the team as they go on city tour, which will culminate in the Red Carpet Premiere at the London Film Festival. I’m delighted that this occasion is being celebrated with cuisine from my restaurant.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Maharashtra government spend on preventi.description: MUMBAI: The state’s economic survey paints a grim picture: Cases registered involving crimes against women and children have risen. Kidnapping cases of women increased by over 23% and molestation by more than 16% in 2018. Also, 169 children were murdered in 2018 as compared to 147 in 2017—a nearly 15% rise. Rape cases of minors too rose by over 15% and their kidnapping cases by 3%. The survey report states that the Maharashtra State Commission for Women spent Rs 1.52 crore in 2016-17 and Rs 3.49 crore in 2017-18 on awareness activities to curb crime against women. A women rights activist said, requesting anonymity, “Despite spending so much money, it has not helped reduce crime against women, mainly because the real issues are not tackled and cosmetic measures are undertaken.” The #metoo movement, which saw many women voice their agony, has not deterred offenders as number of sexual harassment cases increased over 11% compared to 2017. The number of rape and domestic violence cases, though, decreased-—from 4,320 (2017) to 4,076 (2018) and 6,584 to 5,013 respectively. “Police should treat each woman who seeks assistance with respect. Women should feel safe and confident when she goes to file a complaint at the police station,” said Pramila Sharma, a field coordinator of NGO ‘Kshamata’, which works against human trafficking. Sharma also pointed out that the government should include measures to educate people on importance on women’s security. “We should treat children as citizens of India and not someone as immature or a ‘future’ citizen. They deserve to be treated with respect, unfortunately, many adults are ignorant of this responsibility,” said Pramod Nigudkar, a child rights activist, stressing on the need to generate awareness on the behavioural changes which need to be adopted by adults, recognising their rights. He also pointed out that children should be taught to seek help in case of untoward incidences. The survey states that children, who are the future of the country, “constitute to be its vital resources”. They need special attention and care during childhood years, thus various schemes for child development are being implemented, it says. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. After Gujarat septic tank deaths, Amitab.description: MUMBAI: Actor Amitabh Bachchan late Saturday night put out a tweet expressing his anguish over the death of seven persons while cleaning the septic tank of a hotel in Fartikui village of Dabhoi taluka in Vadodara. Responding to Mahindra Group chairman, Anand Mahindra’s tweet on the mishap, Bachchan said: “Anand …I had gifted 25 machines to BMC and a truck to them... the machines were given to individuals, the truck to BMC... a company in Aurangabad makes them ...never publicised it because that is not the reason for the gift... it’s horrifying to learn of this day in and day out.” Anand .. I had gifted 25 machines to BMC and a Truck to them .. the machines were given to individuals, the truck t… https://t.co/WT34dyjT2X— Amitabh Bachchan (@SrBachchan) 1560619613000On Saturday evening, Mahindra, in reference to the Vadodara incident, had tweeted saying, “Enough. Enough of this debasement of human life. I had Tweeted about an automated scavenging machine—the Bandicoot—developed by young students. Many other machines have also been designed. What’s preventing their widespread adoption? If funding is needed to produce in scale, count me in.” Similar accidents have taken place in areas around the city as well. In May, three men were killed after they inhaled toxic fumes while cleaning a septic tank at a housing society in Thane. In October last year, three sanitation workers died inside a manhole in Dombivli. They were contract labourers employed by a private contractor hired by MIDC (Maharashtra Industrial Development Corporation) to maintain a sewer line in Dombivli. Tilak Nagar fire: Builders\u2019 four fl.description: MUMBAI: Four flats belonging to the two absconding developers of a Tilak Nagar building that caught fire leading to the deaths of five residents last year have been sealed. The two-bedroom flats are in the same Sargam Society building which was found to have several illegalities that likely contributed to the deaths. Tilak Nagar police have moved the 72nd metropolitan magistrate, Vikhroli, over sealing flats 601, 702, 801 and 1101 of the C wing as builders Hemendra Mahapara and Subhak Mahapara have failed to turn up before the police despite reminders. Builders had sold off refuge area, building had no fire NOCThe Mahaparas were declared absconders by court earlier and a lookout notice is out to prevent them from fleeing the country. They have been booked for culpable homicide not amounting to murder, negligence, act endangering life of others, etc. The builders are accused of several illegalities in the building, including giving possession without occupation certificates and NOC from the fire brigade, selling off the 15th floor refuge area, selling open parking near the main gate and thus blocking entry to fire engines, and an inadequate fire-fighting system. The Mahapara brothers and Mukesh Kothari are partners at Reliance Realtors, which constructed Sargam Society, where fire engulfed a wing on last December 28. After Subhak’s bail plea was rejected, the brothers went into hiding and switched off their phones. Kothari was arrested after his anticipatory bail was rejected. “In March, court had proclaimed them absconders and sent summons to appear before the police, but they failed,” said inspector Sunil Kale of Tilak Nagar police. Later, the lookout notice was also issued against the duo. Police teams have visited Surat and other parts of Gujarat to trace the, but to no avail, said senior inspector Sushil Kamble. Earlier, six of their bank accounts were also frozen and policemen were posted at their construction sites in Mumbai in a bid to corner them. With the builders on the run, construction at their sites has come to a halt, said some residents of Chembur. The police say they need custodial interrogation of the two to get details of the various documents submitted to the government agencies. They have got some of the papers they had submitted to the BMC. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Science and arts students push up cut-of.description: MUMBAI: As degree colleges on Monday declared their first cut-offs for admissions, principals lamented the fall in the minimum score required to get admission into BSc in the city. They said the lack of demand among students for pure science courses was a worrisome trend. “Every year, we are seeing a drop in the BSc cut-offs. It is sad that no one wants to join the sciences,” Jai Hind College principal Ashok Wadia said. Shobana Vasudevan, principal of Podar College, said their cut-offs had risen marginally for commerce. Students from science and arts applying for BMS have increased tremendously, pushing up the cut-offs, said Vasudevan. While the cut-off for arts for students from boards other than state board at St Xavier’s College was 98.4%, for HSC students it closed at 98.42% in the first round. After admitting students in the in-house quota, St Xavier’s had about 12 seats for students from other boards and eight for the ones from the HSC board. In Mithibai and Ruia, arts closed at over 95% in the first list, a welcome trend, said principals. All these colleges have seen a marginal increase in their arts cut-offs. “The rise can be attributed to the majority constitution of in-house arts students belonging to the open category seeking admission back into Ruia, as a consequence of which the arts cut off may have gone up for 2019,” Ruia College principal Anushree Lokur said. She said the rise only applies to the open category of admissions for the year. Among the job-oriented, self-financed courses, cutoffs for BMS (Commerce) rose to higher than 95% in some colleges, whereas in most colleges a drop was seen in the case of BFM, another popular course. “The cut-offs for seeking admission into NM College in comparison to last year are very similar and there is only a marginal difference for this academic year,” NM College principal Parag Ajgaonkar said. (With inputs from Gargi Agrawal)Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Sadhvi Pragya.description: NEW DELHI: BJP MP from Bhopal Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur created a controversy on the first day of 17th Lok Sabha on Monday when she suffixed the name of her spiritual guru with hers while taking oath, drawing objections from the opposition. Amid protests and shoutings, Thakur said that it was her full name and she had already mentioned it in the form she had filled for oath taking. The mention of Swami Purna Chetnanand Avdheshanand Giri as suffix to her name evoked sharp reaction from the opposition members who said that such a thing was not permitted. She insisted that the suffix was part of her full name, resulting in an uproar from opposition and slogan shouting in her favour from the ruling benches. Following the din, Pro-tem Speaker Virendra Kumar asked the Lok Sabha secretary general about Pragya's full name. Amid noise and objections, Kumar ruled that only the name written in her election certificate issued by the returning officer would go on record. Thakur, the Malegaon blast accused, took oath in Sanskrit and ended it with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogan. Thakur defeated Congress stalwart Digvijay Singh to enter the Lok Sabha for the first time. Later, BJP members continued to raise 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogans, teasing the opposition. They started raising slogan after oath taking by every BJP member. After Ganjendra Umarao Singh Patel (BJP) completed his oath with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai', N K Premchandran (RSP) urged the Pro tem Speaker to maintain the prescribed format of the oath. The Pro tem speaker ruled that the members stick to the format provided. After this, the members of BJP started adding 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' after end of every oath. Some of the prominent names who took oath from Madhya Pradesh included K P Yadav who defeated Jyotiraditya Scindia, Rakesh Singh, Ramakant Bhargava and Nakul Nath. Indore MP Shankar Lalwani took oath in Sindhi. In Video:Lok Sabha: Sadhvi Pragya made to take oath againDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Commerce cut-offs rise in Mumbai college.description: MUMBAI: The first cut-offs for admission to top-rung degree colleges crossed 95% in some of the popular self-financed courses, a phenomenon most prominently seen in the commerce stream. BCom at HR College was available only for those scoring above 96% on the first day of admissions, up from last year’s 95%. At N M College and Jai Hind College, the cut-offs were 93% and 90%, respectively. The cut-offs in self-financed courses, especially in allied commerce ones, rose by one to two percentage points in most colleges. “With the cut-off being so high, no HSC student has made it for BCom as the cut-off is 96%,” HR College principal Parag Thakkar said. “It’s all ISC and CBSE students. For the courses where the cut-off ranges from 95% to 96%, just about one or two HSC students have made it.” He expressed surprise at receiving more applications for “plain” BCom. “The cut-off for that too is more than the self-financing courses,” the HR College principal said. Most seats in top colleges were taken by students from CBSE and ICSE boards. The higher cut-offs in the first list made it difficult for state board students, with comparatively lower marks, to get a seat. BSc cut-offs in many colleges fell dramatically; at Jai Hind, it dipped to 70% from 77% last year. (With inputs from Gargi Agrawal)Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mumbai: Medical student jumps off buildi.description: MUMBAI: A 21-year-old youth studying in GS Medical College committed suicide by jumping from the terrace of his building at Dadar early Monday. While the reason behind the extreme step is still not clear, police said he had told his parents he was finding it difficult to cope up with two papers of Physiotherapy. Police have not found any suicide note. According to the police, the deceased, Onkar Mahesh Thakur, was the son of senior BMC officer, Mahesh Thakur. He was in the fourth year of Physiotherapy. Onkar is survived by his parents and an older sister studying in the US. Around 3.30 am on Monday, the security guard of Kohinoor Towers on Bal Govindas Road heard a loud thud. When he went to check, he found Onkar lying in a pool of blood. He alerted building residents who called the police and rushed him to KEM Hospital where he was declared dead before admission. Shivaji Park police have registered an accidental death report (ADR). Probe is on to find out how Onkar got access to the terrace keys. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nVir Das hosts special screening of '31.description: Actor Vir Das recently hosted a private screening of Shivaji Lotan Patil’s '31st October', which released yesterday, for close friends at a suburban cineplex in Mumbai. Among those spotted at the do were Ramesh Taurani, Milap Zaveri, Neha Dhupia and Rannvijay Singha. Produced by Harry Sachdeva’s Magical Dreams Productions Pvt Ltd, co-produced by Anand Prakash with an all India release by Panorama Studios, '31st October' has Soha Ali Khan sharing screen space with Vir. Soha attended the screening with her husband Kunal Kemmu, who couldn’t stop praising her earnest portrayal of a Sikh woman. People even got emotional after watching the soul-stirring dramatic thriller. Listen to '31st October' songs on Gaana.com01:5931st October: Official trailerDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. In Video:Govt has taken measures to set up 'chowkidar' in space: PM Narendra Modi in OdishaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

\u2018Police trying to hush up boat sink.description: MUMBAI: A day after a ferry boat sank 500m off Madh-Marve shore, the two survivors claimed police were trying to hush up the matter and didn’t lodge a case as they are “shielding” a builder who runs the service. The police had claimed the duo may have fallen off the boat due to strong winds. “At 4pm, the boat was heading to Versova when it started to sink. Sameer, a local, and me caught rubber tubes and stayed afloat,” said Narendra Kumar. “There was no safety equipment ...I learnt that Sameer had gone to the police station, but the cops didn’t register a case.” Malwani senior inspector Deepak Phatangare and Versova senior inspector Ravindra Badgujar didn’t respond to TOI calls. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Ashish Shelar meets junior colleges in M.description: MUMBAI: Newly appointed school education minister Ashish Shelar on Monday met principals of top junior colleges in the city to seek feedback on whether it was viable to increase up to 8% seats in arts and commerce and 5% in science for the first year junior college admissions. The idea is among one of the solutions proposed to give SSC students a level playing field in FYJC admissions after their results were impacted by the discontinuation of internal exams in languages and social sciences. Shelar and education department officials met close to 60 principals at Jai Hind College. A principal who attended the meeting said: “We were told that they were considering increasing seats at our colleges. We were asked for feedback and there was a mixed reaction from the attendees. Some principals raised concerns over the lack of infrastructure or staff and the need for a long term solution for the same.” Currently, aided divisions have 120 seats while unaided divisions have 80 students. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\u2018Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil in cabine.description: MUMBAI: Congress and NCP reacted sharply to the induction of former leader of opposition Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil into the state cabinet on Sunday. Senior NCP leader and former deputy CM Ajit Pawar said it was unethical to induct the leader of opposition into the cabinet. “We’re surprised over Radhakrishna Patil’s induction soon after he quit as leader of opposition. The CM is setting a bad precedent. It is anti-democratic and unethical,” Pawar said. State Congress chief Ashok Chavan too said it was wrong on the CM’s part to engineer such defection. “It may not be illegal, but is against high traditions of democracy...,” Chavan said. He said it was wrong to induct him, particularly when after quitting the legislative assembly, he is not a member of any house and he cannot become a member in the next six months, since the tenure of the assembly is coming to an end before six months. CM Devendra Fadnavis justified the induction of both Vikhe Patil and Jaidutta Kshirsagar into the cabinet, saying, it was well within rules of the legislature. “They’ve resigned from the assembly. As per rules, they can be inducted into the cabinet even if they are not members of any house, but will have to be elected within six months,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nSpecial screening of 'Motu Patlu Kings.description: Joining yaaron ke yaar Motu Patlu on their action safari were B-Town celebs and their young ones in a special preview screening hosted by Farah Khan. The director-choreographer turned host for this 3D adventure animation film, produced by Viacom18 Media Pvt Ltd, Cosmos Entertainment and Maya Digital Studios. The makers of 'Motu Patlu Kings of Kings', which releases this Friday, will donate Farah’s participation fee to an animal welfare organisation she supports, World For All. Along with Farah were the two do-gooders Motu and Patlu themselves, who spread the cheer at this screening, wowing both celebrities and their kids alike. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP Mumbai unit chief leaps to big leagu.description: MUMBAI: For BJP Mumbai unit president Ashish Shelar, it was just a matter of when he will join the big league. On Sunday, he was inducted as the minister for school education, sports and youth welfare. The move assumes significance as it comes during admission season. These departments were earlier held by Vinod Tawde, who will be now left with higher and technical education, welfare of minorities and Marathi language. Shelar, who started his political career during his student days in 1988 with ABVP, was seen as a potential state-level leader. A law graduate and two-term corporator, he became an MLC in 2012 before contesting the assembly polls in 2014. Meanwhile, he got opportunities to prove himself as a election strategist in the 2017 civic polls. During his term, BJP’s tally in the BMC reached up to 83 when Sena-BJP contested separately. He has also been actively focussing on the city’s civic infrastructure and other issues. He is said to share a good rapport with Amit Shah as the BJP national president has visited him at his residence several times during his Mumbai visits. Shelar is involved the sports sector, taking a cue from NCP chief Sharad Pawar. The former chairman of Mumbai Cricket Association also held the post of chairman of BCCI marketing committee. He worked with the Mumbai football association and Rope Skipping Association and has been vice chairman of the Rajasthan Sports Club. In BJP circles, the CM's decision to give school education department to Shelar is being viewed as a setback for Tawde. In the other decisions during the reshuffle, Sambhaji Patil Nilangekar has been given food & civil supplies, consumer protection, skill development, ex-servicemen welfare, while Jaykumar Rawal will head food & drugs administration, tourism, protocol and Subhash Deshmukh will head cooperation, relief and rehabilitation departments.’ Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Chanchal Lahiri.description: KOLKATA: After a day-long search for magician Chanchal Lahiri (41),   who disappeared   while performing an underwater escape act in the Hooghly, police on Monday fished out his body from near Howrah. Later in the evening, Lahiri's brother identified his body. An initial police probe established that Lahiri on Sunday had made several mistakes while attempting the stunt popularised by the famous illusionist and stunt performer Harry Houdini almost 100 years ago. Mandrake trying similar stunt earlierMMiC still in shock after magician’s deathLahiri, who was to come out of the water after being thrown in with his hands and feet bound, , but also wore cumbersome clothing and guards that made swimming in the strong current extremely difficult. Magician PC Sarkar, a master of such stunts, said perhaps Lahiri "needed a little more practice". Lahiri's team, too, waited about 15 minutes after he was lowered into the water to raise an alarm. Chanchal Lahiri on the boat moments before he started the stunt on Sunday Lahiri’s hands and legs were tied with ropes and he was chained with six locks. "When he did not surface for a long time, people panicked. Some onlookers said they saw a man struggling, seeking help, in the middle of the river. Police were informed and a team of divers from the disaster management group joined the rescue operation," said DC (Port) Syed Waquar Raza. Cops will probe if he took advantage of some lacunae on part of the administration and probably paid for it with his life. "A case of negligence is likely to be registered," said a source. Lahiri being lowered into the Hooghly river as he performed one of his tricks in KolkataMagician’s body found; peers say he didn’t take proper precaution Sources said Mandrake never mentioned in his permission letter that he was going to jump into the water. "Lahiri stated the stunt was to happen on a boat or vessel. Hence, we allowed him permission," Raza said. The letter added that he wanted to take photographs and perform an extra event around 1.30pm. The final dip made by Chanchal Lahiri"He performed almost an hour earlier. Hence, river traffic police was absent," said a Port division officer. Police said Lahiri drowned around 12.30pm and it is unclear whether he was performing or practising the act. Moments before the stunt on Sunday, Lahiri said, "If you perform a dangerous trick perfectly, you are a magician. If you fail, it is always tragic." Mandrake's body was fished out on Monday"Bound and chained, Mandrake was lowered 30 feet under water. Thousands watched and it is impossible the cops missed the entire episode when even politicians were present," claimed a friend on Monday. In 2013, when Lahiri performed the same stunt, he was assaulted by the crowd of onlookers, who claimed they felt cheated because they had seen through the trick. In Video:Kolkata: Magician drowns in Hooghly while attempting underwater Houdini escape actDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mumbai: PhD holder arrested for stalking.description: MUMBAI: A 50-year-old PhD holder was arrested from his Satara residence on Saturday for allegedly stalking an IIT-B student and sending at least two dozen obscene messages to her. The case was registered at Powai police station three months ago after the victim complained that Vijay Deshmukh continued to harass her on social media and her college email ID by sending obscene messages and objectionable pictures even after he was sacked from the institute in 2018. “The accused, who is unemployed and unmarried, was issued summons as the incident occurred between 2016 and 2019,” said a police officer. “He didn’t respond to the summons, so we sent a team to Satara and nabbed him. His mobile phone has been sent to the forensic science laboratory to retrieve the obscene messages and objectionable clips that he had sent to the victim.” The complainant, the daughter of a professor, was studying engineering from IIT-Bombay, Powai, when she first met Deshmukh, who held a practical class. In the complaint, she said: “In 2016, Deshmukh sent a friendship request on my social media account. I ignored it. But as he kept inundating me with similar requests, I blocked his number, but he stalked me using different accounts. He even sent obscene messages on my college email.” She complained to the IIT-B women cell in 2018 and he was sacked. “When the student returned from her foreign study tour in December, she realized that Deshmukh was still sending her obscene messages. She informed her brother and friend, who advised her to file a complaint,” said the police officer. Deshmukh got bail on Sunday, said Powai police senior inspector Anil Pophale. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

CM Devendra Fadnavis announces Rs 15,500.description: MUMBAI: Ahead of the state assembly elections in October, the Devendra Fadnavis government appears to be on a mission to complete disbursement of grants under various schemes. Addressing the media on the eve of the budget session, the chief minister said the state was releasing around Rs 8,000 crore for farmers, besides around Rs 7,500 crore from the PM’s Kisan Fund to 1.2 crore farmers. “We hope to complete disbursement of Rs 6,000 to each of the 1.2 crore farmers before the Kharif season begins,” he said. He indicated pre-election sops to the Dhangar community which has been demanding reservation for a long time. “At the budget session starting Monday, you will see a major decision for the Dhangar community,” Fadnavis added. He said this was the only government that had resolved long-pending demands such as the Maratha reservation. “Legal hurdles surrounding Maratha reservation have been resolved and admission of students has been completed successfully,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. In Video:Congress refused to forge alliance with AAP for LS polls: KejriwalDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Mumbai civic body says its new projects.description: MUMBAI: Dadar, Sion, Mahim and King’s Circle harbour several chronic waterlogging spots, and the most notorious of them all is Hindmata, known to go under water on any heavy rain day. This year, the municipal corporation says it is better prepared and will clear water from Hindmata faster. Though the BMC does not guarantee a totally flood-free area, it says the drain augmentation work it carried out in Hindmata will ensure rainwater does not remain accumulated for long periods. A visit to several waterlogging spots identified by the traffic police in Dadar, Sion, King’s Circle and Mahim found that while many works had been completed, concerns among locals remained. Works to reconstruct 2,500 metres of storm water drain (SWD) lines were taken up by the BMC around Hindmata — at Madkebuwa Chowk at Parel and Lalbaug police chowki. In the stretch from Lalbaug police chowky to Shravan Yashwante Chowk, while earlier there was an SWD line of 3000 mm by 2700 mm, there is an extra SWD proposed of 1,800 mm diameter, said officials. This work, though not fully complete, is expected to provide some relief. “This is a low-lying area and one cannot give a guarantee that water will not accumulate on a heavy rain day. But with augmentation works done, we hope that unlike earlier years, when rainwater would remain for an entire day, the accumulation may last only a few hours,” local corporator Urmila Panchal from the Shiv Sena said. A resident of Bhoiwada, Panchal said pumps for de-watering had also been placed. Then there are the other waterlogging spots like Dadar TT and Five Gardens. Dadar Parsi Colony resident Zarine Engineer said: “Dadar TT would previously witness a lot of waterlogging but that has reduced now considerably. With waterlogging spots identified in the area, my only concern is that that manhole lids are placed in all areas.” In King’s Circle, Gandhi Market remain a flooding spot. “It’s a very complex issue as we are not able to find space for laying an SWD line,” an official said. Local corporator Rajeshree Shirwadkar said she had six flooding spots in her area. “The problem with Gandhi market is that there is a water line running below, owing to which the SWD system cannot be widened,” she said. “The solution may be the pending Mahul pumping station.” In Mahim, spots like Mahim junction, Lady Jamshedji Road and Mahim Causeway see localised flooding. Officials said they placed pumps there. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Mumbai: Fire breaks out in barrack at ol.description: MUMBAI: A fire broke out at Mumbai airport’s old air traffic control complex in Sahar on Monday evening. A Mumbai airport spokesperson said that the fire broke out in an unoccupied Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) barrack which was located in the air traffic control complex. “No one was injured. The fire was brought under control by our fire fighting team,’’ said the airport spokesperson. As the building where the fire broke out was close to the complex’s compound wall, the raging fire was visible from the road that ran adjacent to it. Priyanka Gandhi.description: RAE BARELI: In her scathing attack on BJP and Modi government, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that Congress doesn't need any certificate from anyone to prove its nationalist feelings. "Ye brashtachar ki baat karnewale sabse bade brashta hain… kaam ki baat karte hain magar sabse bade nikamme hain… dharma ki baat karne wale sabse bada adharm kar rahe hain - dharm ka istemal kar rahe hain… saheedon ka istemal kar rahe hain - sirf rajinit ke liye (They are talking of acting against corruption but are corrupt themselves… they talk of work but are good for nothing… they talk of dharma (read duties) but indulge in adharma by defying its norms - they use religion and martyrs for political interests)," Priyanka stated in her closed door meeting with cadres on Thursday. The Congress leader hit out at BJP's strategy of playing the nationalist card. "We are Congress… we launched the freedom movement… gave our blood and sweat… braved British atrocities … we don't need any certificate to prove our nationalist feelings especially from the ones who apologised to the British at that time", asserted Priyanka, urging the workers to go to every household in their area and meet every voter. She directed the workers to apprise the voters that the 2019 Lok Sabha election was as important as the freedom movement. Infusing energy in them she said, "Don't be afraid of anything as this is a weak government. Only a weak government curbs the voice of the people, which is a crime in democracy." Priyanka asked the workers to stand up for their leader whose only dream is the progress of India and its people. "Rahul thinks of the people without any vested interest," Priyanka said citing the example of her conversation with Rahul on the issue of using self-help group women for campaigning. "When I proposed to him this idea, he simply denied… saying that I created the SHGs to empower women, not use them in any way," Priyanka said quoting her brother. The Congress general secretary told the workers that she was working on mission 2022. "We will, with your support, form the government in 2022. And once we come, we will stay here for long on the basis of our hard work," she said adding that the hard-workers would be adequately rewarded. Maharashtra government figures misleadin.description: MUMBAI: Former CM and Congress leader Prithviraj Chavan on Monday described as misleading the findings in the economic survey. “It appears a jugglery of words and figures. Information is contradictory and misleading. From developments in the industrial sector, it has been established that the outcome of the Make in Maharashtra and Magnetic Maharashtra campaigns was negligible. It’s an alarming situation,” he said. Chavan said the government has admitted the number of vacant posts has increased by 30,000. “What happened to the CM’s promise to fill up 72,000 vacant posts?” he asked. On the rate of growth, it has been said it will be 7.5%. “Economist Arvind Subramanian had expressed doubts about the authenticity of data released by the government of India. I doubt if the state government too has used techniques adopted by the Centre to mislead people,” Chavan said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Number of road mishap deaths rises 7% in.description: MUMBAI: The Maharashtra Economic Survey shows that 820 more lives were lost in mishaps across the state in 2018-19 as compared to previous year. The report shows that an average 36 people died in road accidents in the state daily. While the number of mishaps registered by the police have dropped in two years, the fatalities have risen and this was a disturbing trend, said experts. In Mumbai, however, there was a dip in road fatalities by 20% in the past one year. The fatalities across Maharashtra rose 7% from 12,264 to 13,084 in a year while the fatalities in road mishaps in Mumbai dipped from 490 to 410. The number of mishaps dropped from 39,848 cases across state to 35,955 in two years. Transport expert A V Shenoy said the main cause of accidents was indiscipline among drivers, speeding or overtaking and lack of sleep. “Human error is the number one cause of accidents followed by other factors like technical fault in vehicle,” he stated. The survey report mentioned that the number of accidents per ten thousand vehicles in Maharashtra during 2018 was 10. The number of valid motor driving licence holders in the state till March, 2018 was 3.41 crore, showing an increase of 4.1% over the previous year. The number of licences issued by RTOs in 2017-18 was 18.1 lakh, the report stated. A senior official from transport commissioner’s office said: “We have introduced compulsory audio-video training on road safety for those applying or coming for renewals for commercial driving licencesThey are being sensitized to drive safely, specially on arterial roads and highways and to ensure safety of pedestrians and other motorists.” A robust electronic enforcement system which includes speed cameras, CCTV cameras, speed guns has ensured violations are captured on the road, another official stated. According to Dr Rita Sawla, founder director of RADHEE Foundation, which works in the field of emergency medical care, an average 55 people were critically injured in road crashes in Maharashtra daily. “Many end up as paralytic, maimed or bed-ridden for life,” she pointed out, adding that there was a huge burden on health infrastructure due to the increasing number of mishaps in the state—with patients sometimes unable to get ICU admission in hospitals as beds are occupied. “When a patient is taken from one hospital to another in search of a bed, it further worsens his health condition,”' she observed. Officials from the transport department had identified 1,324 black spots (vulnerable to accidents). Of these, nearly 369 are being attended to while 955 will be rectified by March 2020, a source said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Anantnag Encounter.description: SRINAGAR: An Army Major died while another officer of the same rank and two soldiers were injured in a gunfight at Bidoora village, in Achabal area of south Kashmir's Anantnag district, on Monday, a defence spokesman said. A Pakistani terrorist was killed in the encounter. Major Ketan Sharma of 19 Rashtriya Rifles, who died in the Achabal encounter, belonged to Meerut. A police officer said they had found the body of a Pakistani terrorist and seized arms and ammunition from the encounter site. The identity of the slain terrorist was being ascertained. In another attack, at least nine Army soldiers were injured in an IED blast that targeted a security vehicle of 44 RR at Aarihal village in Pulwama on Monday evening. Those injured in the Achabal gunfight and IED blast were rushed to the Army's 92 Base hospital in Srinagar, officials said. In the third attack in 24 hours, terrorists lobbed a grenade at the headquarters of the 180 CRPF battalion camp in Tral sub-district of Pulwama late on Monday evening. The grenade exploded outside the headquarters. No casualties have been reported. The first attack happened on Monday morning when a team of security men was on a cordon-and-search operation in Achabal. Terrorists fired at the team, who then retaliated. In the Pulwama attack, the terrorists after setting off the IED, opened fire at the Army vehicle. "Initial reports reveal the vehicle suffered extensive damage," the official said. Three of the soldiers injured in the blast were said to be serious, sources said. Soon after the attack, Army, police and SOG reinforcements were rushed to the spot and a massive search operation was launched. A defence spokesman, however, said some of the men sustained minor injuries in the IED blast. Damage was minimal due to the alertness of the patrol party, he said. The vehicle was an armoured ALS and not a Casspir (a mine-resistant, ambush-protected vehicle), he added. Mumbai: Three cadaver donations in a day.description: MUMBAI: Ten patients battling organ failure got a new lease of life as city hospitals facilitated three cadaver donations on Sunday - the highest in a span of 24 hours. Among the donors was a 17-year-old boy from Andhra Pradesh, a 35-year-old Juhu businessman, and a 44-year-old accident victim from Mulund.The donations, carried out at Lilavati in Bandra, Jupiter in Thane and Global Hospitals in Parel, have taken the year’s cadaver donation count to 45. The city is shy of just three donations from touching 2018’s tally of 48. The donation has facilitated 11 transplants. Besides, two hearts, livers and six kidneys harvested from the donors, corneas, too, could be retrieved from one of them. Juhu resident Rahul Saraf was visiting the GST office at Lotus InfoCentre on Thursday when an iron rod fell on him. He was certified brain dead on Sunday following which his family consented to donate his organs. His heart and lungs were transplanted into a 23-year-old woman, while his kidneys saved two lives at Global and KEM hospitals. The 17-year-old donor was undergoing treatment at Lilavati Hospital. It is learnt after he was declared brain dead, his family consented to donate his organs. His heart was transplanted into a nine-year-old girl, who was waitlisted on June 14. The 44-year-old woman from Mulund met with an accident that involved her husband and other family members too. “Though the donor’s brother also died and several members suffered injuries, the family agreed to donate her organs,” said transplant coordinator Aniruddha Kulkarni of Jupiter Hospital. Her liver, kidneys and cornea were donated. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Encephalitis.description: Bihar is in the grip of Encephalitis. At least 108 children have lost their lives due to acute encephalitis syndrome (AES) in its Muzaffarpur district. AES accompanies flu-like symptoms such as high fever, headaches and convulsions. Japanese encephalitis virus (JEV) is the major cause of AES in India besides other sources such as bacteria, fungus, parasites, spirochetes, chemicals, toxins, and non infectious agents. Here's more. While producers Deepshikha Deshmukh and Vashu Bhagnani played perfect hosts, the lead stars Sonu Sood, Prabhudheva and Tamannaah interacted with the guests and posed for the shutterbugs. Shweta Pandit, Arjan Bajwa, Murli Sharma, Ravi Kishen, Gizele Thakral, Akanksha Puri, Gurmeet Choudhary and Debina Bonnerjee were among the other guests who were spotted at the event.
