Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. Mumbai: Free BEST rides up to 2km likely.description: MUMBAI: After announcing that there should be minimum bus fare of Rs 5 for a 5km distance, municipal commissioner Praveen Pardeshi on Sunday said that buses plying on 2km routes between Metro stations and commercial hubs/offices should offer “free rides” on an experimental basis. Sources said the objective was to increase ridership, which has fallen drastically over the years, to 50 lakh from the present 25 lakh. It will also encourage more office-goers to use public transport, thus reducing the congestion and pollution caused by private cars. Pardeshi, who is positive about reviving the cash-strapped BEST, has also proposed having more AC buses on busy routes, with at least 200 smaller AC buses hitting the roads by October-November, and increasing the BEST fleet to 6,000 buses in two years. He also suggesting introducing an app to provide live tracking of all buses with the “expected time of arrival”, to ensure that passengers wait for buses and do not switch to autos or taxis. BEST general manager, Surendrakumar Bagde, said he will be meeting Pardeshi on Monday to finalise the new fare structure and other sops to be given to passengers, and the related financial burden. “We expect BMC to compensate for the losses incurred by providing highly subsidised fares,” he said. This kind of fare reduction would mean a death knell for share autos and taxis on feeder routes, he added. “We expect 450 Mini/ Midi AC and non AC buses to hit the roads by November, and 80 electric buses by year end. These will be mainly deployed on feeder routes,” he stated. Shashank Rao, leader of the BEST Workers’ Union, who had signed the MoU allowing the wet leasing of smaller buses, is also the leader of the the largest autorickshaw union in the city. He believes that the MoU is in the best interest of the BEST workers, and that the auto business will not be hit. Further, Rao demanded a crackdown on the illegal autos plying without permits and driver badges. Pardeshi, who is keen to strengthen the city’s public transport, said that buses should have more visibility on roads, should be affordable for commuters and efficient in service. The areas which are likely to witness more AC buses in the near future include Fort, Churchgate, Nariman Point, Lower Parel, Mahalaxmi, Elphinstone Road, Dadar, Malad, and Goregaon, among others. The app will also be launched once BEST implements its Intelligent Transport Management System. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Southwest monsoon to hit Maharashtra by.description: PUNE/MUMBAI: With the effect of cyclone 'Vayu' on the southern peninsula getting over, the delayed southwest monsoon is now expected to arrive in Maharashtra by June 21, the IMD predicted on Monday. The much-awaited monsoon is expected to reach southern Konkan and Goa by June 21, and is likely to cover the entire Maharashtra by June 24 or 25. "While the monsoon is likely to cover the entire Maharashtra, good rains are expected over the parched regions like Marathwada and Vidarbha, which are currently reeling under water crisis," an India Meteorological Department official said in Pune. He said though the monsoon got delayed due to 'Vayu', it's expected to move forward rapidly. "The progress of the monsoon will be rapid after June 21. The monsoon is likely to cover 90 per cent of the country by July 4," he said. The official said despite the delay, the monsoon is mostly expected to cover Karnataka, remaining parts of Tamil Nadu and Telangana, Odisha, and parts of the North East later this month. "Though the effect of 'Vayu' is over, there will be widespread heavy rains over parts of Kutch and Saurashtra in Gujarat and East Rajasthan by tomorrow," he said. Meanwhile, the India Meteorological Centre has predicted moderate showers in Mumbai and surrounding areas over the next two days, while south Konkan will receive higher intensity rain during the same period. A met department official said the forecast for Marathwada region, which was that of a dry spell this week, was Monday changed to one with isolated showers in some pockets. The Madhya Maharashtra region will also get showers in a few isolated places, and so will Vidarbha, though the rain will be of low intensity, the Met department said. CM Devendra Fadnavis: Decision on conges.description: MUMBAI: The state government will decide on imposing congestion charge for vehicles in Mumbai once the under-construction Metro rail begin services, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis told TOI on the eve of the budget session of the state legislature. A recently concluded conference on eco-friendly transport for Mumbai held by Maharashtra Pollution Control Board (MPCB) jointly with NEERI and Mumbai First suggested Re 1 per km fee for private cars and SUVs and 50 paise for two-wheelers. These charges, aimed at reducing traffic on road and thus fuel consumption and pollution, are then proposed to go to BEST and other mass transport modes to improve services. BEST has welcomed the move. Mumbai is the ‘Most Traffic Congested City’ in the world with 65% congestion meaning road commuters spent 65% extra travel time. 40,000 doctors boycott work in Maharasht.description: MUMBAI: More than 40,000 doctors in Maharashtra are boycotting work on Monday as part of a strike call given by their apex body IMA in support of their agitating colleagues in West Bengal, an official said. Doctors, from various government and private hospitals in the state, are mainly boycotting the OPD (Out-Patient Department) and other non-essential health services, he said. The Indian Medical Association (IMA) earlier gave the strike call for Monday, with withdrawal of non-essential health services across the country in the wake of the recent assault on doctors in West Bengal. "Over 40,000 doctors and other medical practitioners in Maharashtra have decided to support their colleagues in West Bengal who are protesting against their Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee," an IMA official here said. However, the emergency services will not be affected and those already hospitalised will continue to get all the necessary medication and attention, he said. "The OPD services have been suspended at various hospitals in support of the strike call," IMA Maharashtra's honorary secretary Dr Suhas Pingale told PTI. Junior doctors in West Bengal are on strike since June 11 after two of their colleagues were attacked and seriously injured allegedly by relatives of a patient who died at the NRS Medical College and Hospital in Kolkata. In a show of solidarity, medical practitioners across the country have decided not to work, leaving patients in the lurch. The IMA has demanded a comprehensive central law in dealing with violence on doctors and health care staff. Security measures and the determinants leading to violence should also be addressed, it said earlier in a statement. Exemplary punishment for perpetrators of violence should be a component of the central law and suitable amendments be brought in the Indian Penal Code (IPC) and Code of Criminal Procedure (CrPC), the IMA said. The medical body launched a four-day nationwide protest from Friday and wrote to Union Home Minister Amit Shah, demanding enactment of the central law to check violence against health care workers. Mumbai: Constable booked, suspended for.description: MUMBAI: The senior inspector of Boisar-MIDC police station has filed a case against a constable for allegedly trying to bribe him to turn a blind eye to the illegal activities in his area. The constable has been suspended. Inspector Janardhan Parabkar (50) on Sunday filed a case against Palghar local crime branch (LCB) constable Ramesh Naukudkar (42). In his complaint, Parabkar alleged around 7 pm on June 11, Naukudkar approached him at the police station and offered money to overlook illegal activities like drug trafficking, bootlegging and gutka smuggling in Boisar and Tarapur areas, which falls under Parabkar’s jurisdiction. Boisar police have been cracking down on illegal sale and transport of gutka, drugs and other crimes in their jurisdiction. Sources said since about a month, Naukudkar had been visiting the Boisar police station and asking Parabkar to go slow on the drive. When Parabkar refused to budge, the constable reportedly raised the bribe money. This angered the inspector who filed a case. It is not known how much money was offered. A case under the Prevention of Corruption Act has been registered against Naukudkar, who was suspended on Monday. Police officials said that an internal inquiry will be initiated into the allegations and Naukudkar will be terminated if he is found guilty. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nSpecial screening of 'Chaar Sahibzaade.description: The makers of director Harry Baweja’s 'Chaar Sahibzaade — Rise of Banda Singh Bahadur', Eros International and Baweja Movies Pvt Ltd, had organised a special celebrity screening of the 3D animated movie, which hit screens yesterday. While the 2014 prequel had received thumbs up from the industry, the sequel had generated a lot of buzz, making it one of the most anticipated movies of 2016. In fact, the makers had hosted a screening of the film to army personnel and gallantry award winners in the Capital as well. Harry had said, “Banda Singh’s story is an inspiration for every generation and his struggle as a general resonates with the valour of our army personnel.” While Rowena and Pammi Baweja and Krishika Lulla played perfect hosts, Mandira Bedi, Siddharth Anand, Raj Kundra, Poonam Dhillon, Ramesh Thadani, Sagarika Ghatge, Ashish Chowdhury and Sanjay Suri were among those spotted enjoying the film. With Ashish Shelar in cabinet, Manoj Kot.description: MUMBAI: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) member of Parliament Manoj Kotak is the frontrunner for the post of party’s city unit chief as the incumbent Ashish Shelar has been appointed as a cabinet minister in the Devendra Fadnavis government. BJP’s constitution has provisioned for one-man, one-post and it will have to look for a new BJP chief for Mumbai. BJP appointed J P Nadda as working president, after party chief Amit Shah took over as Union minister for home. “Kotak, who is close to Fadnavis, is the frontrunner for the job,” said a BJP functionary said on the condition of anonymity. “Fadnavis would like to see his man appointed as the city BJP chief.” Both, former MP Kirit Somaiya and the dropped cabinet minister Prakash Mehta, had been the Gujarati faces of the party for decades. However, the leadership has now decided to look beyond these two as they have fallen foul of the party leadership. “Kotak’s appointment will send out the message that the party has the interest of the community in mind. Hence, the party has also appointed BJP MLA from Charkop, Yogesh Sagar, as minister of state in the Fadnavis cabinet,” said a party functionary. Also, the chief minister is wanting to have his men to be a bridge between the Gujarati-Kutchi community and him, instead of depending on Mehta and Somaiya. Kotak, though a Gujarati, is very fluent in Marathi. “His appointment will not be looked upon as BJP favouring Gujarati over a Marathi. He has a good connect at the grassroots level as he was a corporator on three occasions,” said a source. Another BJP functionary said, “He is well aware of playing to the gallery as he took the oath as an MP in the Lok Sabha on Monday in Marathi. Whereas, Poonam Mahajan and Gopal Shetty took the oath in Hindi.” While Shiv Sena was averse to Kirit Somaiya, it had no qualms in extending support to Kotak. BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. Mumbai: Guitar player found dead in Aare.description: MUMBAI: A 33-year-old man who worked in a media company was found dead in a pond at Royal Palms in Aarey Colony, Goregaon (E), on Saturday night. Residents from the locality later identified him as Sohan Chauhan. Police are trying to find out what led to Chauhan’s death. No injuries were found on his body and it is suspected he drowned. Around 7.35pm, Aarey Colony police were informed about a body floating in a pond, behind bungalow 25, overlooking Imperial Palace Hotel. “There is no approach road and one would have to scale down the backside of a row of bungalows. As there are no cameras facing the pond, it is not clear how and why Chauhan went there,” said a police officer. After the body was sent for autopsy, police made inquiries in the neighbourhood to establish his identity. Locals said he lived at Ruby Building and was known to play the guitar well. His brother later approached the police station. Chauhan's wife was in north India at the time. They had wed six months ago. An accidental death was recorded. In May 2018, Atharva Shinde, the 20-year-old son of a police officer, was found dead along the same pond. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Despite 2018 drought, Maharashtra\u2019s.description: MUMBAI: Though drought swept through Maharashtra over the last year, leading to a major dip in farm output, the state’s economic growth rate for 2018-19 is set to remain unchanged at 7.5%, the figure for 2017-18, according to the state’s economic survey released on Monday. By contrast, the national growth rate is pegged at a lower 6.8% for 2018-19. The survey shows although growth rate in the agricultural and industrial sectors is set to decline compared to 2017-18, in the services sector it is expected to rise from 8.1% to 9.2%. Given the much higher share of the services sector in the computation of the value of economic activity in the state, this rise appears to have restored the growth rate. The survey showed a decline in estimated growth rate in the agricultural sector from 3.1% in 2017-18 to 0.4% in 2018-19 as a result of drought. While crop output showed growth of (-)8% in 2018-19, the survey forecast a rise in growth rate of several other segments. Growth rate in the livestock segment is expected to rise sharply from 8.5% in 2017-18 to 13.9%, while that in forestry and logging is set to double from 8.1% to 16.4%. Even the fisheries segment is expected to see a major rise from (-)11.7% to 3.4%. Maharashtra faces industrial slump, debt set to soarGrowth rate in the industrial sector is set to fall from 7.6% to 6.9%. The manufacturing sector is set to see a decline from 7.7% to 7.1%, while that in electricity and other utilities is estimated to decline from 6.5% to 4.3%. Mining and quarrying are expected to see a big dip from 7.2% to 2.9% But growth rate in the construction sector is set to improve significantly from 7.9% to 9.9%. Within the services sector, the financial, real estate and professional services segment is set to see a rise in growth rate from 7.6% to 9.4% while the trade, hotels and communications segment is expected to improve its growth from 7.6% to 9.4%. Asked about the dip in industrial growth, finance minister Sudhir Mungantiwar said, “Poor monsoon affected segments beyond agriculture. Yet we have sustained growth. PM Modi has said the country will be a 5 trillion dollar economy. Maharashtra’s contribution to it will be 1 trillion dollars.” The state’s financial position is still a concern, with debt estimated at Rs 4.14 lakh crore for 2018-19 compared to Rs 4 lakh crore in 2017-18. But the state says this is 15.6% of GSDP, well within the fiscal limit of 22.3% laid down by finance commission. Data has shown employment of 73.50 lakh in 2018 compared to 67.50 lakh in 2017. Of total employment reported, 31.1% was in public sector. On government jobs, sanctioned posts in July 2018 were 7.17 lakh, of which 1.91 lakh had been filled. Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Crop output dips, eats into Maharashtra.description: MUMBAI: The state’s economic survey for 2018-19 details the decline in crop output as a result of the drought over the last year, especially in the rabi or winter crop, where the production of foodgrains is set to decline by 63% over the previous year. TOI had reported on the drop in the rabi crop output on June 7. The winter crop covers an average 53 lakh hectares in Maharashtra. The kharif or monsoon crop stands on roughly 150 lakh hectares and is the main crop in the state. The drought in 2018-19 affected 42% of the state’s talukas and has caused a severe water crisis. Live water storage in the state’s dams is 6.43% of total capacity. In Marathwada, it is just 0.5% of capacity. The production of rabi cereals is set to decline by 68%, pulses by 51% and oilseeds by a huge 70%, the economic survey shows. The output of rabi wheat is expected to fall by 61% and maize by 75% and harbhara (gram) by 52%. Within the oilseeds cluster for the rabi crop, the production of sesame (til) is expected to fall by as much as 92%. The picture for the kharif crop was mixed. The estimates show that despite the drought, sowing for the kharif crop increased, though very marginally. While the production of kharif foodgrains is set to decline by 12% in 2018-19 compared to the previous year, the output of kharif oilseeds is expected to rise by 16%. Sugarcane production is set to increase by 10% and cotton by 17%. However, within the oilseeds cluster, groundnut production is expected to decline by 33%, sesame by 58% and sunflower by 74%. The output of kharif cereals is expected to decline by 6% compared to 2017-18, while the pulses output is expected to fall by 35%. The production of toor dal is set to fall by 45%. However, the production of rice is set to rise by 28% and soyabean by 20%, the data shows. The area under horticulture also saw a decline. During 2018-19, the area under horticulture crops is 16.43 lakh hectares, and production is expected to be 224 lakh tonnes. In 2017-18, the area was 17.22 lakh hectares, and production was 248.53 lakh tonnes. The decline in horticulture output was 9.6%. CM Devendra Fadnavis had earlier, after chairing the kharif review meeting, said that “despite the drought, the state has managed an output of 115 lakh metric tonnes, which is higher than other drought years.” According to him, “This is because of our water conservation initiatives and increased investment in agriculture. In 2012-13, despite 90% rainfall, agricultural output was 128 lakh tonnes. In 2014-15, with 70% rain, it was 82 lakh tonnes. In 2018-19, with 73% rain, it was 115 lakh tonnes.” The CM had said that although delayed, the forecast for this monsoon was excellent. The forecast for central Maharashtra was 93-107%. Even in arid Marathwada, the forecast was 89-111%. “We will use SMS services to communicate forecasts to farmers so they can sow at the right time. Over the last year, 40 crore SMSes were sent,” he had said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mumbai: Jilted lover posts 'terror' thre.description: MUMBAI: The Thane police have arrested a man from Mumbai who posted alleged 'terror threats' in a prominent shopping mall here to harass his ex-girlfriend, an official said on Monday. The so-called 'terror threats' were discovered on Sunday afternoon, scrawled on some advertising pamphlets in the ground and first floor restrooms of Viviana Mall in the city, sending shockwaves among local people. They read: "Gazva-e-Hind", "Dadar Siddhivinayak Temple Boom", "ISIS is Coming, Slipper cell is activated", according to Thane Police Commissioner Vivek Phansalkar. Additionally, there were two mobile numbers found, one of a girl and another of a boy, penned in the same writing with the same sketchpen, police said. Thane Police teams, including the Anti-Terrorist Squad, swung into action immediately, and zeroed in on the girl and the boy from the phone numbers. The youths, both working in a local company, were brought in for interrogation. During questioning, the girl admitted to a seven-year long affair with one boy from Vikhroli, in northeast Mumbai, but they had split recently. She suspected he could be responsible for the 'terror threats'. Police secured the address of her former boyfriend, Ketan Ghodke, and despatched a police team which picked him up from his home in Vikhroli late on Sunday. During interrogation, Ghodke finally confessed that he had written those 'terror threats' only to harass his ex-girlfriend and her new boyfriend. Though Ghodke claimed he had no links with extremist groups and pleaded that his act was intended to teach a lesson to the girl and her friend, police have arrested him. While people from Thane heaved a sigh of relief, police are investigating the matter further against the backdrop of the Maharashtra Legislature session which started on Monday. BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

60% of doctors in Maharashtra hospitals.description: MUMBAI: Assaults, threats and shoving—60% resident doctors have endured one of these during their round-the -clock schedules in Maharashtra’s public hospitals, according to a study conducted by NGO CEHAT along with Maharashtra Association of Resident Doctors (MARD) and KEM Hospital. Of the 193 resident doctors who participated in the study, which was undertaken after a resident doctor in the Dhule Government hospital was beaten up by a mob in 2017, many confessed that they no longer proactively offer advice to patients. “Our study’s most important finding is that residents feel their workplace is unsafe,” said senior resident Dr Yashowardhan Kabra, who was the central MARD president when the study started in Marbrought into the casualty, the study found that only 31% of the assaults occurred in the casualty. The departments of general medicine (12.9%) and paediatrics (10.9%) were vulnerable too. Mobs were responsible for almost three-fourth of the attacks. Ministers dropped not over work, but onl.description: MUMBAI: Six ministers submitted their resignations on the directive of chief minister Devendra Fadnavis before he expanded the cabinet on Sunday. The CM, however, refuted charges that they were dropped due to non-performance and said the decision was taken amicably to pave way for new faces. “We discussed the reshuffle among all of us and took a collective decision. The allegations made by opposition against them were baseless and have no impact on the reshuffle. Opposition could not provide right evidences to support their allegations resulting in clean chit to them,” the CM added. Rajkumar Badole, Vishnu Sawara, Dilip Kamble, Praveen Potey and Raje Ambarish Atram resigned on Saturday, Prakash Mehta followed suit on Sunday. “As per the procedure, resignations were submitted to Raj Bhavan and they have been accepted,” a senior bureaucrat. Fadnavis said the intention was to give chance to a newer lot to perform and take benefits of the government schemes to more and more areas. Asked about the probe and action against Mehta, he said the state's action-taken report on the Lokayukta's report on slum redevelopment scam will be tabled in both Houses of the legislature “I am sure that the truth will come to the fore to clear all the doubts," he added. According to a bureaucrat, it was found that the performance of Badole, Sawara, Kamble, Potey and Atram was not up to the mark; in fact their presence was not felt in their departments or as constituencies. In case of Sawara, it was allegedly found that as a leader of the tribal community he was not able to give new direction to the crisis-ridden department. “We were expecting, he will provide crucial guidelines for the welfare of tribals, but he did not move of his home town,’’ the bureaucrat said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mumbai: Drunk man outside railway loo wo.description: MUMBAI: A 28-year-old man dragged a uniformed railway constable towards the railway tracks at GTB Nagar station and threatened to throw him in front of a running train around midnight on Saturday. The accused, Murugesh Devendra, was furious after the cop pulled him up for blocking access to a public toilet at the station. When reinforcements were called in, Devendra tried to flee but the cops nabbed him. “Devendra has been booked for assaulting a public servant and for intimidation,” said senior inspector Rajendra Pal, Wadala GRP. Constable Omprakash Munde, 27, was on night duty on Saturday. Around 12.05am, the operator of a public toilet on platform 1-2 told Munde about a man lying sprawled at the entrance to the toilet. Munde went to the man (Devendra) and woke him up. Devendra, who was sloshed, had collapsed in front of the toilet. Angry at being woken up, he hurled abuses at Munde. Expecting him to get violent, Munde called up his colleague, Shende, for help. Shende, who was on duty at Chunabhatti station, reached GTB Nagar. Meanwhile, Devendra ran towards Munde and started hitting him, leading to a scuffle between the two. According to the FIR, Devendra started to drag Munde towards the tracks and said he was going to “push the cop on the tracks, in front of a running train, and kill him”. By then, Shende reached the spot and found the two grappling. Shende rushed to his colleague’s aid. “By then, Devendra realised he was going to get caught. He bit Munde’s fingers and jumped onto the space between two sets of tracks in order to flee. Munde and Shende followed him on the tracks and managed to nab him,” said Pal. Devendra was brought to Wadala railway police chowky and arrested. Munde was sent for a medical check-up. The police said Devendra does odd jobs and lives in Mankhurd. He was travelling ticketless when he was caught and the police may apply charges relevant under the Railways Act. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. \nArjun Rampal celebrates Navratri at Da.description: Arjun Rampal, who plays Arun Gawli in an upcoming biopic on the gangster-turned-politician, visited Gawli’s neighbourhood on Thursday evening to participate in the Navratri celebrations there. Arjun has been working on the film, titled 'Daddy', over the past few months. A large part of the biopic has been shot at South Mumbai’s Dagdi Chawl, where Gawli grew up and rose to power. The actor took to his social media page to thank the film’s crew and also the city’s police force for helping out with the shoot, which wrapped up early this week. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\u2018Miss Indias are the ones to watch.description: This is her first visit to India, but the reigning Miss World, Vanessa Ponce de León Sánchez, is already in love with our butter chicken. While firangs usually pick up the chicken bits, this one loved the gravy too and “almost licked the plate clean” when she had her first serving. Vanessa, in Mumbai for the Miss India grand finale, which was held on Saturday and is keen to see the city. “I will have only one day for sightseeing and so, I want to go to the Marine Drive and The Gateway of India. The latter, I know, is a historical place. I’ve seen very old pictures of the Gateway and it’s lovely. Of course, I’ll keep eating more Indian food, especially butter chicken, which I love already,” said the 27-year-old as we settled for a quick chat with her at a suburban hotel suite. Excerpts... You were the first Mexican to win the crown last year. How has your journey been so far as Miss World 2018?The moment I was crowned, my life changed completely. I travelled all over and closely witnessed the Beauty With A Purpose projects that the other contestants have been doing in different countries. I am really proud of being their sister and very proud of being Miss World 2018. It’s been wonderful to be a part of this legacy. You were one of the judges at the Miss India grand finale. How was it?All the girls who participated in the Miss India pageant were super strong contenders. They dance, they sing, they play instruments, they do something artistic, they have amazing Beauty With A Purpose projects and they are beautiful! So, Miss Indias are the ones to watch out for when you go for Miss World. What is your plan forward?I want to open my own non-profit and I will continue working with all the other non-profits I already have, like my own multipurpose project, which includes a rehab centre. I want to give the message that volunteering is important and everyone can help. My mission in life is to help more people, so, I will keep doing that. It has been six months, half way though my year and I have learnt a lot, met people, learnt patience and discipline. These projects alone don’t solve the situations in the country, but we are helping so much. It is a long-term process, so be patient, keep working for it every single day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

FYJC admission row: Maharashtra threaten.description: MUMBAI: The Council for Indian School Certificate Examinations has called out the state government for proposing to not take internal marks given to non-state board students into consideration for FYJC admissions so that SSC students can compete with them on an equal footing. In a letter to the education department on Monday, the council has called the decision to be “not only mala fide, but also illegal and liable to be struck down”. This year, SSC results took an over 10% hit as the board withdrew 20-mark internal exams for languages and social sciences. Following an outrage, then education minister Vinod Tawde met with senior officials and principals to review the results and came up with a formula to help SSC students in the FYJC race. Among the solutions proposed was to exclude internal exam marks for CBSE and ICSE students and to increase seats in sought-after junior colleges. The education department then wrote to the CBSE and CISCE demanding they share the details of the marks of internal/practical/oral and theory examination in each subject. While the CBSE has already shared the data with the education department, the CISCE has registered its displeasure. The council, in its letter, has stated that the education department’s communication threatened that if the data was not furnished, then students who passed out of ICSE will not be allowed to participate in class XI admission procedure. “In their last letter on June 16, we were informed that CBSE had shared the data and if we failed to do so by Monday evening, ICSE students would be allowed to participate in the admission process only after the third round,” Gerry Arathoon, secretary and chief executive officer of CISCE told TOI. The council’s letter, a copy of which is with TOI, said, “At the outset, we wish to submit that the state government cannot act unilaterally and in a discriminatory manner as sought to be done. The purported move is not only arbitrary but also unconstitutional and is liable to be withdrawn forthwith…We submit that the present decision of the state is not founded on fair play and equality and the same is not consonance with known norms applicable to the field in which policy decision are taken.” The CISCE has said it is preparing the details for languages and social sciences, but would require at least a couple of days to compile the data. “The CISCE reserves its right to challenge the aforesaid decision of the state government,” said the letter. School education secretary, Vandana Krishna, to whom the letter is addressed said, “Nothing is finalised yet. The state is considering the options. The minister will decide on Tuesday.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Eight cops go to ATS despite Mumbai poli.description: MUMBAI: Eight police personnel have been transferred to ATS despite the police commissioner objecting to their direct request to the DGP, bypassing him. Police commissioner Sanjay Barve on June 11 had issued show-cause notices to over 12 policemen, asking why he should not take disciplinary action against them for not following the protocol on transfers. Barve had told them to reply by June 13. Most officers replied that they did not intend to disrespect the city police chief and such requests had been made earlier too. The 12 had written to DGP S K Jaiswal seeking transfers to ATS. Those transferred include senior inspectors Nitin Alaknure, Dinesh Kadam, Nandkumar Gopale, Gnyaneshwar Wagh, Sudhir Dalvi, Rajesh Bhuyar, Umakant Adki and Santsoh Bhalekar. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. In Video:BJP announces 28-year-old Tejasvi Surya for Bengaluru South seatDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Maharashtra: As school dropout rates ris.description: MUMBAI: In spite of various schemes brought in to ensure free and compulsory education, the dropout rate at the upper primary and higher secondary levels in Maharashtra continues to rise. The dropout rate of upper primary students has gone up from 1.06% (2016-17) to 1.56% (2017-18), whereas that for higher secondary school students increased from 2.4% (2016-17) to 2.9% (2017-18). Educationists have, however, said that the numbers, even if higher compared to previous years, don’t show the real picture. “The dropout data varies from source to source, and there is no uniformity. However, there is also a shortage of colleges across the state which could result in dropout at the higher secondary level. The dropout rate could be higher if compared from Class I enrolments vis-a-vis Class XII enrolments,” said Hemangi Joshi, an RTE (Right to Education) activist. Activists have also called for a central admission and monitoring system to plug the gaps in data. “Currently, the state doesn’t know where the dropout is happening, especially after Class X and Class XII, since the students don’t necessarily opt for a higher secondary course or college degree. We have time and again written to the government to bring in a monitoring system which can track all students across institutes in the state and country,” said Vaishali Bafna of SYSCOM, a Pune-based think tank. Experts also feel the need to concentrate on quality of primary education. “It is easy to say that students drop out of the education system because of poverty, but a large number lose interest in education as the quality of education is poor. There is also a lot of inter-state migration which displaces students and causes children to drop out,” said educationist Heramb Kulkarni. He had been following up with the state for the past few years when the government introduced drives to identify out-of-school children in the state. The survey report has mentioned that Samagra Shiksha is an integrated scheme being implemented in the state from 2018-19 by subsuming three schemes, that is, Sarva Shisha Abhiyan, Rashtriya Madhyamik Shiksha Abhiyan and Teachers Education. The Union government has made a financial provision of over Rs2,480 crore for the state during 2018-19. According to government data, the total number of primary and upper primary schools is 1.06 lakh, while the number of secondary and higher secondary schools comes to 26,857. The number of students enrolled in primary and upper primary schools across the state is 1.59 crore; for secondary and higher secondary schools, the number comes down to 66.5 lakh. \nSwara Bhaskar's web series screened in.description: One of India’s fastest growing media conglomerates, Viacom 18 launched its latest web series, '#ItsNotThatSimple', on its digital platform Voot. The makers also held a special screening of the show on Monday to select guests from the industry. Some of the celebrities who turned up at the venue to support the shows included Imran Khan and Avantika Malik, Aamir Ali and Sanjeeda Shaikh, Danish Aslam, Shruti Seth, Mini Mathur and Gul Panag. A six-episode web series starring Swara Bhaskar, Karanveer Mehra, Vivan Bhatena and Akshay Oberoi, the show has a funny take on urban marriage. Comedian Angad Singh Ranyal’s comic take on love, relationships and marriage was a treat for the audience. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Physiotherapy student jumps to death fro.description: MUMBAI: A 21-year-old physiotherapy student allegedly committed suicide by jumping from a building at Dadar here in the wee hours of Monday, police said. Omkar Mahesh Thakur, went to the terrace of 'Kohinoor Tower', located on Bal Govind Das Road in Dadar area, around 3.30am and jumped from there, a police official said. A passerby spotted Thakur lying on the ground in a pool of blood following which he was rushed to a nearby hospital where doctors declared him dead, he said. Thakur, who lived in an apartment on the building's fifth floor, was studying physiotherapy at the KEM Hospital in Parel area here and was in the last year of the course, he said. The reason behind the extreme step was yet to be ascertained, the official said, adding that the deceased's friends and colleagues at the hospital were being quizzed. An accidental death report was registered and a probe was under way, he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Gold worth Rs 10 crore seized, seven arr.description: MUMBAI: Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) officials seized nearly 33 kg gold worth Rs 10.5 crore on Friday and claim to have found for the first time Myanmar markings on the gold bars. Seven people who ran courier agencies in the city have been arrested. Officials said the gold was in the form of bars and biscuits and weighed between 100 gm and 1 kg. Besides the gold smuggled through the Indo-Myanmar border, officials found gold had also been illegally brought in from Dubai and some of the seized gold had Swiss markings. Some gold bars had been tampered with to conceal the country of origin. DRI officials said it was not clear how the gold reached Myanmar. The strategy was to transport gold smuggled through Kolkata, Hyderabad and Delhi airports to the city with the help of small-time courier agencies for a fee. The courier agencies charged between Rs 200 and Rs 700 per kg (the legal courier fees per kg) gold. DRI sources said the courier companies received the parcels at the cargo terminal. The consignments would arrive without the address of the consignee being mentioned. A call would be made to the sender and, based on instructions, the gold would be delivered. The smuggled gold was delivered to jewellers operating in Kalbadevi, Zaveri Bazaar, BKC and other places in Mumbai for a hefty commission. Following a tip off, the DRI intercepted 12 cargo consignments at the office of Concor Air Ltd, an agency that deals in domestic air cargo, at Santacruz. Four of the arrested have been released on bail. Three other arrested accused, Sanjay Didwania (49), Manohar Kothari (47) and Jaiprakash Saini (29), were produced before the Esplanade court and sent to judicial custody till June 30. The senders have not been arrested and DRI is conducting further raids across the country. DRI officials said this was the new modus operandi being adopted by smugglers to dodge authorities. Mum: DRI rescues lemur, vervet monkey, e.description: MUMBAI: A vervet monkey, a lemur, a civet and exotic cats were among the animals seized during raids held at illegal pet trade shops for a second day across the city. Some of the exotic animals, like the lemur and vervet, were stuffed into cages which were further shoved into bags. Besides, at least 250 exotic birds, including yellow budgies and green conure, were found packed into 20 to 25 tiny cages. Six people have been arrested and Rs 1.09 crore seized from the shops. Some of the exotic animals and birds are delicate and need to be handled with utmost care, said Dr Jitendra Ramgaonkar, deputy conservator of forests. LemurThe raids were conducted at pet shops in Crawford Market, Kurla and Govandi by officials of the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) with the help of the state forest department. Deputy director of DRI, Prashant Kumar, refused to comment. “I can’t comment as of now. We are still in the midst of investigation,” he said. The forest authorities cannot file a case against illegal pet traders in this case since, technically, exotic animals are not classified under the Wildlife Protection Act. “But these exotic animals are being illegally brought into the country and traded. Some of them could also be bred internally. So, DRI officials have initiated action against the traders for violation of the foreign trade policy and have booked them under the Customs Act,” Dr Ramgaonkar said. The animals have been handed over to the forest authorities and could be handed over to animal welfare organisations for foster care. Most of the birds are affected and not in good shape, said Dr Priti Sathe, veterinary officer at Thane. “Many birds, including a pair of Rosellas, have contacted a viral infection that causes a discharge from the eyes and makes them shed feathers,” said Dr Sathe. The environment in which some of the animals were crammed in was “pitiable”, said Pawan Sharma of Resqink Association for Wildlife Welfare, who helped in the veterinary care. “There was no ventilation and it must have been claustrophobic for the animals and birds,” said Sharma. “They were dehydrated and sitting in their poop. It was stinking badly.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

JP Nadda.description: NEW DELHI: Ending speculation over the appointment of a working president, the BJP parliamentary board on Monday appointed former health minister and senior leader Jagat Prakash Nadda to the post even as home minister Amit Shah will continue to be party president. Nadda's appointment as working president was on the cards after he was not inducted into the government. Since Shah will need to meet his ministerial commitments, Nadda, as a full time party functionary, is expected to help him with the nitty-gritty of organisational tasks. "I am confident that under the leadership of Amit Shah and JP Nadda, and powered by the hard work of our karyakartas (workers), BJP will continue winning people's trust and serving our society. We remain committed to building a strong, developed and inclusive India," PM Modi tweeted. I am confident that under the leadership of Shri @AmitShah and Shri @JPNadda, and powered by the hardwork of our Ka… https://t.co/EyDidISB2W— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) 1560786282000Modi said Nadda is a diligent worker who has risen through the ranks due to his hard work and organisational skills. "Humble and affable, he is widely respected across the BJP family. Congratulations to him on becoming the working president of the party," the Prime Minister added. Announcing the decision, defence minister Rajnath Singh said, "BJP won several elections under leadership of Amit Shah. But since PM appointed him home minister, Amit Shah himself said the responsibility of party president should be given to someone else. BJP Parliamentary board has selected JP Nadda as working president." Modi and other parliamentary board members including Shah, Rajnath Singh, Union ministers Nitin Gadkari, Thawar Chand Gehlot and senior BJP leaders Sushma Swaraj, Shivraj Singh Chauhan and Ramlal greeted Nadda after his selection as party working president. Hailing from Himachal, Nadda (58) has held several organisational posts at the national and state level. This will be the first time the party has appointed a working president. After considerable discussion it was decided that Shah's continuance would be required in view of important state elections coming up and the party also announced a membership drive and organisational elections that will keep cadre busy for several months. Singh said Nadda will remain the working president till BJP's membership drive and organisational elections are over. Process of the organisational elections has already begun as state unit elections are likely next month. As per procedure, it takes four-five months to complete the entire organisational elections. Singh said the parliamentary board wanted that Shah should look after the party as president until organisational elections of the party are completed. "However, Amit Shah himself urged that as home minister, he can't do justice with responsibilities as party chief and wanted someone to take over after which the parliamentary board unanimously selected Nadda as working president," Singh said. Nadda was mentioned as a likely party chief in 2014 when Rajnath Singh resigned after joining the Union ministry. However, Shah took over as party president. Nadda has long experience of the party organisation as he was the in-charge of the party headquarters and is a popular figure. In Video:JP Nadda elected as BJP Working President in DelhiDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Kandivali jewellery workshop worker held.description: MUMBAI: Police have arrested a 21-year-old man for stealing gold ornaments worth Rs 28 lakh from a Kandivali West- based gold polishing workshop where he worked. The accused was arrested from Hyderabad on charges of theft within 48 hours of the crime. Safutullah Gayani, the accused, was working at a gold polishing unit owned by Rampad Santra at Sai Nagar for the past eight months. There were four other workers at the unit. Every evening, the unit's manager, Shaikh Momin, would collect ornaments polished by the staff and lock it in a vault inside the workshop. The key to the vault used to be with Momin. All the employees would sleep inside the workshop at night. On June 11, Rampad received a consignment of bangles and pendants weighing 1kg for polishing. The order was to be completed soon. The workers worked till late and went to sleep around 6am on June 12. At 10.30am, the shop owner received a phone call from a nervous Momin. He told Santra that 1kg gold ornaments had vanished from the vault. CCTVs in the unit showed Gayani applying glue on every camera. One of the cameras outside the shop had captured him walking away with a carry bag. After Santra lodged a police complaint, the police checked Gayani's call data record (CDR). "Gayani wasn't carrying his cellphone. We contacted the people and learnt that he was on his way to Pune and then to Hyderabad. Our team picked him up from Hyderabad," said senior inspector Nitin Pondkule. Gayani admitted to taking out keys to the vault from Momin's trouser pocket, while he was asleep. He claimed that his employer hadn't paid him his salary, but Rampad has denied this. "The entire looted gold ornaments have been recovered from Gayani," said DCP Sangramsinh Nishandar. "The accused has worked in a few other polishing units before. Employers should conduct police verification of each of their staffers," he added.
